Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is partially covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, with applied band of 'pie-crust' decoration, is covered with a brown slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394197) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394197)
